Key Match Events: Ireland came agonisingly close to pulling off another stunning victory over Pakistan, falling to just a three-wicket defeat with seven balls to spare.
Shaheen Shah Afridi bowled Andy Balbirnie with just the third delivery of the match.
Shaheen Shah Afridi accounted for both Lorcan Tucker and Harry Tector.
Mohammad Amir removed Paul Stirling and George Dockrell.
Ireland closed out the powerplay on 32-5.
Haris Rauf dismissed Curtis Campher, reducing Ireland to 32-6.
A partnership of 44 for the seventh wicket between Gareth Delany (31) and Mark Adair (15) saved Ireland from their lowest score in T20I cricket.
Josh Little’s 22 not out and Ben White’s contribution ensured Ireland reached three figures.
Mark Adair and Barry McCarthy struck with the new ball to give Ireland hope.
Curtis Campher picked up the scalp of Fakhar Zaman.
Barry McCarthy collected two further wickets, reducing Pakistan to 57-5 at the halfway stage.
Ben White dismissed Abbas Afridi with the score 95-7 in the 18th over.
Babar Azam steered his team over the line with an unbeaten 32, supported by Shaheen Shah Afridi’s 13*.
Barry McCarthy (3-15) and Curtis Campher (2-24) were the pick of the Irish bowlers.
